FareStructureElement.Name: Available zones
FareStructureElement.Description: Trip may start in a city zone and continue to distance section

FareStructureElement.Name: Available Intervals
FareStructureElement.Description:
How are West of England Zone single fares calculated? In the West of England Zone single fares are worked out based on the route distance you are travelling. Distances are calculated using fare stage sections rather than individual bus stops, with each section being approximately one mile long*. If you travel in 1-3 mile long sections it'll be 2.50, 3-6 mile long sections will be 3.50 and so on.
Here is an example route and some of the fares along it: Emersons Green, Sainsbury's to Long Close would be 2.50 as you are travelling in three sections (numbers 1, 2 and 3, Long Close is classed as section 3 in this example as it's where you are getting off the bus). Long Close to Narroways Road would be 3.50 as you are travelling in four sections (4, 5, 6, 7, Long Close is counted as section 4 in this example as it's your boarding point). Blackberry Hospital to Downend, The Leap would be 3.50 as you are travelling in four sections (5, 4, 3, 2).

FareStructureElement.Name: Overall journey steps
FareStructureElement.Description: Journey is potentially made up of two steps

FareStructureElementInSequence.Name: Optional fisrt leg in inner zone
FareStructureElementInSequence.Description: If a journey begins within a flat fare zone but travels beyond the border of that zone, the fare will be calculated as follows: Flat fare to the border of the zone, then rounded up to 2.50, 3.50, 4.50 or 5.50 depending on the distance travelled thereafter.

PreassignedFareProduct.Name: West of England Distance based (section fare) trip
PreassignedFareProduct.Description: The cost of single tickets within the West of England will be based on the route distance you travel, with five new single fares available:

SalesOfferPackage.Name: First West of England Distance Based Trip Fare - m-ticket
SalesOfferPackage.Description:
Single trip on stage fare How do mTickets work? Once a ticket is purchased and downloaded, it will appear in the 'purchased' section of the Ticket Wallet in your app. Tickets in this section are listed from the oldest at the top to the newest at the bottom.
When you want to use a ticket, select the one you want and then select 'Activate Now'. You'll then be informed of how long the ticket will be active for, before confirming that you want to want to activate this ticket. We would advise reading this carefully to avoid activating unwanted tickets. Once activated, the app will generate a moving ticket image on your phone's screen and a QR code. This will stay active for the remainder of the ticket's validity and will include the time and a four letter 'word of the day'. You'll need to scan the QR when you board the bus or show the ticket to the driver.

Transferability.Name: Child tickets
Transferability.Description: Customers can send tickets to a child or young person by using the sharing feature on child and young person tickets. As it stands, this function is only available for child tickets - adult tickets cannot be shared. The instructions below tell you all you need to know about sharing a ticket once it has been purchased:

ValidableElement.Name: Unlimited rides available for specifed periods

GenericParameterAssignment.Name: Conditions: non transferable, repeated use etc

UsageValidityPeriod.Name: Validity period - day pass
UsageValidityPeriod.Description:
How long will my ticket be active for? The validity of mTickets is similar to paper tickets. This means a day ticket is not valid for 24 hours, but rather the remainder of the day on which it is activated.
Following this principle, other validities are as follows:
FirstDay - the remainder of the day the ticket is activated FirstWeek - the remainder of the day the ticket is activated, plus an additional 6 days FirstMonth - the remainder of the days the ticket is activated, plus a further number of days in the month less one. A month ticket activated on 25th May for instance, would expire on 25th June. First4Week - the remainder of the day the ticket is activated plus an additional 27 days We also allow a period of grace after midnight, to allow for the last bus services of the day but please note that the expiry date (shown in words on the ticket screen) is the last full day of the ticket and does not reflect the period beyond midnight.
This is so customers do not wrongly believe they have an additional full day's travel.

UsageValidityPeriod.Name: Validity period - period pass
UsageValidityPeriod.Description:
How long will my ticket be active for? The validity of mTickets is similar to paper tickets. This means a day ticket is not valid for 24 hours, but rather the remainder of the day on which it is activated.
Following this principle, other validities are as follows:
FirstDay - the remainder of the day the ticket is activated FirstWeek - the remainder of the day the ticket is activated, plus an additional 6 days FirstMonth - the remainder of the days the ticket is activated, plus a further number of days in the month less one. A month ticket activated on 25th May for instance, would expire on 25th June. First4Week - the remainder of the day the ticket is activated plus an additional 27 days We also allow a period of grace after midnight, to allow for the last bus services of the day but please note that the expiry date (shown in words on the ticket screen) is the last full day of the ticket and does not reflect the period beyond midnight.
This is so customers do not wrongly believe they have an additional full day's travel.

Where you can buy a pass of different duration
What types of pass can be purchased onboard
What types of pass can be purchased online
What types of pass can be purchased at travel_shop
What types of pass can be purchased at PayPoint
GenericParameterAssignment.Description:
PayPoint It's now easier to buy your bus tickets in Bristol, Bath & Weston-super-Mare as the regions biggest operator, has joined forces with PayPoint, the local network of high street retailers, to enable customers to buy bus tickets over the counter at almost 600 outlets in the region. You can now buy your Week and Month tickets from local shops in and around Bristol, Bath, Weston-super-Mare and Frome at the same time as picking up a loaf of bread or pint of milk, or topping up your gas or electricity.
For Terms and Conditions and details of PayPoint agents see link or contact customer services on 0345 602 0121.

PointOfInterest.Name: Bristol Tourist Information Centre
PointOfInterest.Description:
, E Shed, 1 Canons Road, Bristol, BS1 5TX. Located in Bristol's central Harbourside area overlooking the water, located between the Watershed and No.1 Harbourside (less than 2 minutes from the Bristol Hippodrome).
Selling a variety of day, week and month for adults, students and young people (16-21) and children.

FareFrame.Name: First West of England ^amp; Bristol common parameters

FareDemandFactor.Name: Off peak hours
FareDemandFactor.Description: First Day Group tickets allow up to 5 people, unlimited travel all day until 4.29am the following day in your chosen area. Tickets can be bought after 9.30am Monday to Friday and all day Saturdays, Sundays and Public Holidays.

Tariff.Name: First photo id
Tariff.Description: Children aged 5-15 get up to 50% OFF all single, day and season tickets Young people aged 16-21 and students get up to 30% OFF all singles, day and season tickets (excluding West of England Plus)
Tariff.OperatorRef: First Bristol, Bath and the West nocn:136361

UserProfile.Name: Child
UserProfile.Description: Children aged 5-15 are entitled to a 50% discount on all tickets across the West of England. We would advise all older children to get a (free) First Photo ID pass as proof of age. If the driver can't be sure how old they are, and they are not able to produce one of these, they may be required to pay a full adult fare, so it's in their interests to have one. An application form can be found on page 23.

UserProfile.Name: Student
UserProfile.Description: 30PCT discount for 16-21 year olds and students. Young people (16-21) and students (of any age if in full time education) can get a 30% discount on all tickets if they have a First Photo ID pass or their student photo ID.

CompanionProfile.Name: Infant
CompanionProfile.Description: Unlimited children under five can travel for free with each fare-paying adult/student/16-21 year old or concessionary pass holder.

UserProfile.Name: Infant
UserProfile.Description: Unlimited children under five can travel for free with each fare-paying adult/student/16-21 year old or concessionary pass holder.

SaleDiscountRight.Name: Photo id
SaleDiscountRight.Description: Please complete the form if you are sending the application by post or alternatively visit your local First travel shop. You will need to include: The completed form A passport sized photo of the pass holder Proof of age (birth certificate or passport ) or proof of student status (a valid NUS/student card). Photocopies are accepted DO NOT send originals. Please send all the above to: Photo ID Applications, First, Enterprise House, Easton Road, Bristol BS5 0DZ or email your details to ticketssww@firstgroup

ValidableElement.Name: Unlimited rides available for specifed periods

DistributionChannel.Name: First travel shop
DistributionChannel.Description: Most of our tickets are available from our First Travel Shops in the following locations. At these shops you can also collect timetables and ask our staff any questions you may have about the local bus services.

CompositeFrame.Name: Travelwest Rider Pass Examples -2019
CompositeFrame.Description: This is an example showing how one might encode part of the Travelwest Rider pass fares, in NeTEx.

FareFrame.Name: Travelwest Avon, Bath, Bristol and Weston Rider products

PreassignedFareProduct.Name: Travelwest Rider Pass
PreassignedFareProduct.Description:
Travelling with more than one bus company? The AvonRider, BathRider, BristolRider and WestonRider are day tickets available to buy on bus, where you can travel on up to 14 different operator services across the area of your choice with just one ticket.
Day | | Week | Adult | Student/Child || Adult | Student/Child ison | 4.00 | 3.00 || 18.00 | 13.50 | /
Rider Tickets Rider Tickets are day tickets that are accepted by all bus operators in a given area Valid for travel on the day of issue and up to 2.59am the following morning. No limit to the number of journeys you can take - all you have to do is show your ticket to the bus driver when you get on. Not valid for tour buses, express coaches, or bus services for special events. Bought on any bus operating in that Rider ticket area - including Park & Ride services.
Buying a Rider ticket using travelcards Load onto a Travelcard (participating operators only). Once loaded onto the card, the same period of validity as above applies. Buy using sQuid balance on a Travelcard (participating operators only). Rider Tickets cannot be bought or renewed online. Student/child Rider Tickets are not available on travelcards.

Travel WesPAYG SMartcard Avon, Bath, Bristol and Weston Rider products

validityParameters.OperatorRef: BCT (Bristol Community Transport also known as CT Plus)

AmountOfPriceUnitProduct.Name: Travelwest PAYG payment
AmountOfPriceUnitProduct.Description:
With Pay-As-You-Go you can buy any available ticket using credit you load onto your Travelcard in advance.
You can top up your Pay-As-You-Go balance by registering your Travelcard at portal.squidcard.com, and collect your credit at a metrobus iPoint, or on any of the following bus services:
Abus. Carmel. Faresaver, Somerbus BCT (Bristol Community Transport also known as CT Plus) The services that accept payments with Pay-As-You-Go balance are the ones listed above and metrobus iPoints.
To use your Pay-As-You-Go balance on the bus simply hold your card to the reader on the bus and inform the driver you wish to buy your ticket with Pay-As-You-Go balance.
To buy tickets at a metrobus iPoint using Pay-As-You-Go simply place the card on the holder, select which ticket you wish to buy and select pay with sQuid.
Some bus operators even offer special 'smart' discounts for customers using Pay-As-You-Go.

DistributionChannel.Name: Bristol Tourist Information Centre
DistributionChannel.Description: Selling a variety of day, week and month for adults, students and young people (16-21) and children.

DistributionChannel.Name: PayPoint
DistributionChannel.Description:
It's now easier to buy your bus tickets in Bristol, Bath & Weston-super-Mare as the regions biggest operator, has joined forces with PayPoint, the local network of high street retailers, to enable customers to buy bus tickets over the counter at almost 600 outlets in the region. You can now buy your Week and Month tickets from local shops in and around Bristol, Bath, Weston-super-Mare and Frome at the same time as picking up a loaf of bread or pint of milk, or topping up your gas or electricity.
For Terms and Conditions and details of PayPoint agents see link or contact customer services on 0345 602 0121.

FareFrame.Name: Freedom pass products

PreassignedFareProduct.Name: Freedom Pass
PreassignedFareProduct.Description: TThe Freedom Travelpass is a flexible ticket for unlimited train and bus travel within four zones. It's valid just for the day, for the week or for the calendar month - it's your choice! Where to buy? - From your First Bus Driver - day tickets only. - From the Ticket Office at your local station - all tickets - From the conductor on board your train if your station is unstaffed - Day & Week tickets - From a First Bus Travel Shop - All tickets A photocard is required for the monthly Freedom Travelpass
